value.title: Getting Started with Power BI Datamart
value.excerpt: In the previous video, you learned what is a Datamart and the use cases of that in a Power BI implementation. In this article and video, you will have your first experience with Datamarts and learn through an example about what it is and how it works in detail. The interesting thing in all the steps

value.title: Multi select slicer in Power BI
value.excerpt: This is a very short, simple video about how to have a multi-select slicer in Power BI. Power BI slicer is in fact multi-select by default, however, there is a very small option that if you set it, makes it even easier to use, let’s talk about it. read my article about this here: https://radacad.com/multi-select-slicer-in-power-bi

value.excerpt: In this short video, I have explained how to pars a column that has JSON data.

value.title: Power BI Design Tip   Design for Mobile Device
value.excerpt: Power BI is a mobile-friendly reporting solution. Every report that you generate can be viewed on the Mobile too. However, it doesn’t mean that the report is designed for mobile, or in other words; it doesn’t mean that is it a mobile report page. You have to make some changes, and take some extra considerations
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/Igkqp-UQzJo" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Replace BLANK with Zero in Power BI Visuals Such as Card
value.excerpt: If you use a field in a visual and based on a combination of slicer selection, that field doesn't have any value, you might see blank in the visual. If you want to replace that blank to zero, here is a trick for you. a very simple trick that you can use anywhere easily. Read more details in my blog post,

value.title: Sentiment Colors for Gauge Visual in Power BI
value.excerpt: Gauge Visual is a great visual for KPIs, however, the Gauge visual in Power BI doesn’t have the sentiment colors as an option. Sentiment colors make a gauge much more understandable, you can easily find out is the value high, low, or in the mid-range. Fortunately, there is conditional formatting that
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/0s72vgeRJok" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Showing Ranking in a Visual in Power BI using RANKX DAX function
value.excerpt: If you want to show the ranking in a Power BI visual, one way is to use a visual that supports that, such as a Ribbon chart. Another way, which is a more common way, is to write a calculation for rank, and RANKX is a DAX function that can help you with that. In this article and video, I explain how that
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/FCWVX8W1QZk" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: TOP N Filter in Power BI with Zero DAX Code   Visual Level Filter
value.excerpt: I have previously written articles about how you can write a measure in DAX that helps with TOP N filtering. However, you may not need that calculation for many situations. If all you want is just simply to get the top 10 customers based on the sales amount, or bottom 5 products, etc, then you can simply

value.title: Trim Vs Clean in Power BI and Power Query
value.excerpt: When applying text transformations in Power BI using Power Query; two very important transformations that can help are; Trim and Clean. These two mistakenly often considered to do one thing, but they are different. In this short article and video, I’ll explain their differences through an example. find

value.title: Visualization Tip   Change to Filter instead of highlight   Control the Interaction in Power BI
value.excerpt: Power BI reports are highly interactive, If you select a column in a column chart other charts will be highlighted. value.title: Introduction to data analytics on Azure
value.excerpt: Introduction to data analytics on Azure

topItems.title: Explore Azure data services for modern analytics
topItems.excerpt: Understand analytics solutions in the Azure data ecosystem. Explore the architecture of a scalable analytics solution to meet business needs.

topItems.title: Understand concepts of data analytics
topItems.excerpt: Explore key concepts of data analytics, including types of analytics, data, and storage. Explore the analytics process and tools used to discover insights.

topItems.title: Explore data analytics at scale
topItems.excerpt: Describe data analytics at scale and understand the roles of a data team. Learn about the responsibilities of an enterprise data analyst and what tools are available to build scalable solutions.

value.title: Explore Azure data services for modern analytics
value.excerpt: Understand analytics solutions in the Azure data ecosystem. Explore the architecture of a scalable analytics solution to meet business needs.

value.title: Explore data analytics at scale
value.excerpt: Describe data analytics at scale and understand the roles of a data team. Learn about the responsibilities of an enterprise data analyst and what tools are available to build scalable solutions.

value.title: Ingest Data with Dataflows Gen2 in Microsoft Fabric
value.excerpt: Data ingestion is crucial in analytics. Microsoft Fabric's Data Factory offers Dataflows (Gen2) for visually creating multi-step data ingestion and transformation using Power Query Online.

value.title: Understand concepts of data analytics
value.excerpt: Explore key concepts of data analytics, including types of analytics, data, and storage. Explore the analytics process and tools used to discover insights.
